metadata.title: CVE-2020-28020 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Exim 4 before 4.92 allows Integer Overflow to Buffer Overflow, in which an unauthenticated remote attacker can execute arbitrary code by leveraging the mishandling of continuation lines during header-length restriction.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-28020` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.94-15ubuntu1
exim4-base - 4.94-15ubuntu1
exim4-config - 4.94-15ubuntu1
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.94-15ubuntu1
exim4-daemon-light - 4.94-15ubuntu1
eximon4 - 4.94-15ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exim4 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.94-15ubuntu1').
